required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Posy Covid-19 Vaccination Development or Flare of ARD
clinical_study.official_title: New or Flare of Musculoskeletal Rheumatic Diseases After Different COVID-19 Vaccines: Multicentre Study

brief_summary.textblock: Many patients develop autoimmune diseases after covid-19 vaccination, whether related to the vaccination or not, is still under study.

detailed_description.textblock:
II. Aim of the work:
- Study new ARD and prevalence of different MSK manifestations after covid-19 vaccinations
- Study prevalence of flare of ARD after covid-19 vaccinations
- Comparison between different types and doses of covid-19 vaccinations in inducing ARD or flares.
III. Method Study Design: Cross sectional study Study setting and duration: University as well as general and insurance hospitals for a period of 3 months.
Sampling (Size and Method): All patients fulfilling the eligibility criteria will be enrolled in the study.
IV. Participants
Target population:
any patient with pre-existing received any vaccination against covid-19 visiting rheumatology outpatient clinic.
-any patient develops MSK manifestations after covid-19 vaccination.
Case Definition:
Eligibility Criteria:
Patients above 18 years old having MRD manifestations vaccinated against covid-19.
Inclusion Criteria:
Age above 18 years Vaccinated against covid-19 (one dose or fully vaccinated)
Exclusion Criteria:
Receiving other vaccine e.g influenza Less than 18 years old

primary_outcome.measure: -Prevalence of new ARD after covid-19 vaccinations
prevalence of flare of ARD after covid-19 vaccinations
primary_outcome.description: flare of any manifestations of the disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of non-specific MSK symptoms after Covid-19 vaccine.
Correlation of the MSK to the 1st and 2nd Covid vaccine dose
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of the MSK to the 1st and 2nd Covid vaccine dose

secondary_outcome.measure: comparison between different type of covid-19 vaccine in inducing ARD or flare up.
disease activity status in the patients who developed the ARD symptoms before and after the vaccine.
secondary_outcome.description: activity assessed by disease activity scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Any correlation between the appearance of MSK symptoms and the patient's medications
